# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code for your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)  # Split text into words
    wrapped_text = ""   # Initialize the output string

    line_length = 0     # Initialize line length counter

    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width
            # If adding new word would exceed max width, start a new line
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            line_length = 0
        elseif !isempty(wrapped_text)
            # Add space if not the first word of the line
            wrapped_text *= " "
            line_length += 1
        end

        wrapped_text *= word   # Append current word to output string
        line_length += length(word)  # Update line length counter
    end

    return wrapped_text
end
```

You can use this function like this:

```julia
print(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer nec odio. "))
```
This will output:
```
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit amet,
consectetur
adipiscing elit.
Integer nec odio.
```
